title: Cant sign in
text:
Why do I need to use the authenticator app to log into the authenticator app? 
That doesn’t make any sense. This has to be a bug.

title: Essential
text: I don’t know too much about security but this app is always quick easy and very secure

title: Needs a refresh
text:
Two things:
A. It needs to better align with the iOS design language. For example, when I pull down the list of accounts it should display a search box. This a pretty common design language across iOS apps. A hold down should be a refresh. 
B. Most other password managers support Apple Watch. Where is the support for Apple Watch? Why? Well because of OTP support. I am all in on OTP in Authenticator but I am thinking of moving to another app because I can get my OTP for certain accounts on my Watch so I always have them handy. Not for all sites but just those that have high frequency of OTP prompting, I use away from my phone, and don’t store extremely sensitive content.

title: Will give five stars when...
text:
Microsoft needs to add datetime stamp values for when a record is created, when a record is modified and when the last time the record was successfully used.

Note:  a ".record" is a collection of fields that contain data about a given entity e.g. a credential entry in MS Authenticator.

title: Seems secure, yet not simple.
text: Seems secure but still not easy to use.

title: Complicated set up but works good after System Admin Intervention
text: Like most Micro$oft products, this app is highly unintuitive and inflexible—designed by and for tech heads, not end users—but works smoothly after some support from our system administrator.

title: Needs dark mode
text: Works fine, but no dark mode.

title: Easy as 1, 2, 3 - seriously!
text: A perfectly simple app that sets itself apart organically. Well done team!
